data.question: What is the title of the research article?
data.answer: Ligand and Metal Based Multielectron Redox Chemistry of Cobalt Supported by Tetradentate Schiff Bases

data.question: Who is the corresponding author of the article?
What is the main focus of the research conducted in the article?
data.answer: Investigating the influence of bound cations on the reduction of cobalt complexes of redox active ligands and exploring the reactivity of reduced species with CO2.

data.question: What type of complexes were formed upon one electron reduction of [Co(II)(Rsalophen)] with alkali metals?
data.answer: Either ligand-centered or metal-centered reduction complexes were formed, depending on the alkali ion.

data.question: True or False: The two electron reduction of [Co(II)(OMesalophen)] results in a Co(I)–Co(II)–Co(I) complex.
What was the outcome of the reaction of complex 6 with ambient CO2?
data.answer: Multiple CO2 reduction products were formed, including the product of CO2 addition to the OMeSalophen ligand and CO32– formation.

data.question: True or False: The electrons stored in the reversible C–C bonds cannot be used for the transformation of carbon dioxide.
What role do bound alkali cations play in the redox processes of the complexes studied?
data.answer: Bound alkali cations have a key role in such processes, affecting the structure of the reduced species and the distribution of electrons.

data.question: True or False: The addition of cryptand to a solution of complex 6 in THF leads to the formation of a dinuclear complex.
What was the yield of CO32– formation when complex 6 reacted with excess 13CO2?
True or False: The reaction of complex 3 with CO2 resulted in the reversible coordination of CO2.
What does the EPR spectrum of complex 7 suggest about its structure?
data.answer: The EPR spectrum suggests the presence of a Co(I) bound to a radical anionic ligand.

data.question: True or False: The structure of the trimer is maintained in solution for complex 6.
What was the effect of removing the bound Na cation from the neutral complex [Co3(tris-OMesalophen)Na6(THF)6]?
data.answer: It led to the cleavage of the C–C bonds and isolation of a new species where the formal oxidation state of the cobalt is (0).

data.question: True or False: The molecular weights of the species can be estimated using the values of the measured coefficient diffusion.
What was the purpose of performing variable temperature NMR analysis in the study?
data.answer: To determine the ratio of monomer/dimer and thus their respective concentration for calculating thermodynamic parameters.

data.question: True or False: The equilibrium constant Keq(T) can be calculated at several temperatures to determine the ratio of monomer/dimer.
What does the Van’t Hoff analysis allow researchers to extract?
data.answer: Values of ΔH° and ΔS° from the slope and the y-intercept of the plot of Ln(Keq) as a function of 1/T.

data.question: True or False: The presence of a Co(0) species in complex 7 can be ruled out by the absence of any sizable hyperfine coupling with the 59Co I = 7/2 nuclear spin.
What was the outcome of the reaction of complex 3 with CO2 in terms of solubility?
data.answer: The reaction resulted in the formation of a completely insoluble product.
